name: Caribbean Parachute
instructions:
1. Add all of the ingredients except tonic water to a shaker with no ice.
2. Shake to combine, then add ice and shake well until chilled and foamy.
3. Add chilled tonic water to an empty Collins glass, then strain the cocktail into the tonic until the top of the drink is half an inch below the rim.
4. Wait for the foam to completely settle, then finish straining the remainder of the cocktail.
description: This rum and tonic adds the building blocks of a Silver Fizz and the balance of a rich amaro, resulting in a beautifully textured highball.

ingredients.name: White Rum
ingredients.description: White rum, also known as light or silver rum, is a type of rum that is clear and colorless. It is often unaged or aged for a very short period in stainless steel or other neutral containers, which prevents it from developing the color and flavor that result from prolonged aging in wooden barrels.

ingredients.name: Lime juice
ingredients.description:
Lime juice is a key player in the world of cocktails, renowned for its bright, sharp, and slightly sweeter flavor compared to lemon juice. Extracted from fresh limes, this citrus juice adds a vibrant, zesty kick to drinks, making it an indispensable ingredient in many classic and contemporary cocktails.


When using lime juice in cocktails, freshly squeezed is highly recommended for its superior taste and aroma. The amount used can vary depending on the recipe, but even a small quantity can significantly brighten and enliven a drink. Its versatility allows it to pair well with a wide range of spirits, from tequila and rum to gin and vodka.

ingredients.name: Amaro Montenegro
ingredients.description: Although not as popular as Averna, Montenegro packs an incredible bouquet of flavors ranging from carmel and chocolate to chartreuse-like herbals, all at a very workable price. As an added bonus, Montenegro is delicious on the rocks and sports an eye-catching bottle.

ingredients.name: Simple Syrup
ingredients.description:
Simple syrup is a basic sweetener used in cocktails, made by dissolving sugar in water. The standard recipe is a 1:1 ratio of sugar to water, although variations exist, such as rich simple syrup, which uses a 2:1 ratio for a thicker, sweeter result. The syrup is clear and easily mixes with both cold and hot liquids, making it an essential ingredient in many drinks.

Simple syrup can also be infused with additional flavors like herbs, spices, or fruits, adding a layer of complexity to cocktails.

ingredients.name: Tonic
ingredients.description: Tonic water is a carbonated beverage that is flavored with quinine, a bitter compound derived from the bark of the cinchona tree. Originally used as a prophylactic against malaria due to its quinine content, tonic water has evolved into a popular mixer for various cocktails, especially the classic Gin and Tonic.
